translation: translated by imperial edict

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，世尊在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園，與大苾芻眾千二百五十人俱。
translation: Thus I have heard. One time, the World-honored One was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Sāvatthī, accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告苾芻眾言：「苾芻！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, saying, Monks!

source_sentence: 一切行遷流，如幻不實、不得久住、無有定相、是顛倒法。
translation: All conditioned forces are like illusions that aren't real, don't abide for a long time, have no set characteristics, and are mistaken dharmas.

source_sentence: 苾芻！
translation: Bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 乃至一切行，垢盡無染離一切垢。
translation: Up to all conditioned things, the defilement ends without defilement and are free of all defilements.

source_sentence: 一切眾生，乃至蠕動及部多等，至壽命盡決定殞滅；
translation: All sentient beings, up to the whirl and many others, will surely die at the end of their life.

source_sentence: 若彼無生即當無滅。
translation: If it doesn't arise, then there won't be cessation.

source_sentence: 若彼長者、婆羅門、剎帝利種族，殊勝豪貴自在財富，無量金銀珍寶及諸受用，
translation: If those wealthy householders, priests, brahmans, and kṣatriya clansmen were so overweeningly wealthy and possessed immeasurable gold, silver, precious treasures, and various enjoyments,

source_sentence: 無所乏少；
translation: Nothing is lacking.

source_sentence: 雖有父母眷屬、親姻知識、吏民僮僕皆悉具足，至壽命盡亦無能免。
translation: Even though their parents, retinues, relatives, friends, officials, and servants are all fully endowed, they can't escape until the end of their life.

source_sentence: 又復剎帝利授灌頂已，為大國王得大自在，有大力勢，人民無量，大地國土皆悉降伏，
translation: Again, when the kṣatriyas had conferred their coronations, they became great kings and attained great sovereignty. They had great power and might, with an immeasurable number of inhabitants, subjugating all the various lands

source_sentence: 至壽命盡亦復無免。
translation: Up to the end of their life, they'll also have no escape.

source_sentence: 又彼仙人林中，諸修行者不貪於味，食諸菓實；
translation: Furthermore, in the forest of that sage, the practitioners did not crave taste and ate all kinds of fruit.

source_sentence: 又復遠離菓實修諸苦行，至壽命盡亦復無免。
translation: Again, he's far removed from fruit and cultivates ascetic practices, and when his life ends, there's no escape.

source_sentence: 「又彼修諸十善，得生四大王天、忉利天、夜摩天、覩史多天、樂變化天、他化自在天；
translation: Again, by cultivating these ten wholesome practices one can be reborn in the heavens of the four great kings, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yama gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati god

source_sentence: 又復修行禪定，得梵身天、梵輔天、大梵天，得少光天、無量光天、極光淨天，
translation: They also cultivate meditation and attain the gods of the Brahmakāyika, brahmākāyika, and mahābrahmā heavens; they attain the gods of lesser luminosity, infinite luminosity, and ultimately pure luminosity

source_sentence: 得少淨天、無量淨天及遍淨天，得無雲天、福生天、廣果天、無想有情天。
translation: They attain the Heaven of Lesser Purity, the Heaven of Immeasurable Pureness and the Heaven of Universal Purity, and the Heaven of Cloudlessness, the Heaven of Virtuous Birth, the Heaven of Extensive Fruition, and the Heaven of

source_sentence: 又彼阿那含得無煩天、無熱天、善現天、善見天、色究竟天。
translation: Also, those non-returners attain the heaven of no affliction, the heaven of no heat, the heaven of good appearance, the heaven of good views, and the form ultimate heaven.

source_sentence: 又彼厭礙色身，修無邊虛空三昧等，得生空無邊處、識無邊處、無所有處、非想非非想處。
translation: Also, they become disillusioned with the body of form and cultivate the limitless samādhi of space and so forth, which gives rise to the limitless state of emptiness, the limitless state of consciousness, the nonexistent state, and

source_sentence: 彼等諸天，雖復殊勝，非彼不生，亦復殞滅。
translation: Even though those gods are superior, it's not that they won't be born and will also die.

source_sentence: 「若彼三界漏盡，已作所作，遠離重擔，逮得己利，盡諸有結，得阿羅漢，
translation: “If the contaminants in those three realms have ended, they’ve done what should be done, are free of heavy burdens, acquire their own benefits, end the bonds of existence, and attain arhatship.

source_sentence: 雖復此身亦當棄捨。
translation: Even so, this body will also be discarded.

source_sentence: 又彼刀兵劫，自修一身處於寂靜，悟諸因緣得中乘證，號辟支佛；
translation: In the eon Sword and Weapon age he cultivated his whole body in quiescence, awakened to all causes and conditions, and attained realization of the Middle Vehicle. His name was pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 雖復此身亦當棄捨。
translation: Even so, this body will also be discarded.

source_sentence: 乃至如來、應、正等覺，十力廣大，四智圓明，說法無畏，正師子吼，
translation: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One’s ten powers are so great that the four knowledges become perfectly clear. He teaches the Dharma with fearlessness, exactly like a lion’s roar.

source_sentence: 歷無數勤勞得那羅延身，亦復棄捨。
translation: After exerting countless efforts to obtain the body of Nārāyaṇa, he also abandoned it.

source_sentence: 「諸苾芻！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 所謂如彼窯師造作坏器、盆甕之類，雖復有成，定從破壞；
translation: It is to be compared with what the founder of the furnace did when he made broken vessels or pot jars. Even if they were formed, they would surely break apart from each other.

source_sentence: 又如菓熟自當墮落，生滅之法亦復如是。
translation: Also, just as a fruit that ripens will fall on its own, so is the law of arising and ceasing likewise.

source_sentence: 諸苾芻！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 一切有情乃至部多，一切含識至壽命盡，無免斯者。
translation: All sentient beings and even a large number of all conscious beings up to the end of their life span are not exempt from this.

source_sentence: 如無有生，即當無滅。」
translation: If there's no birth, then there won't be cessation.

source_sentence: 「如來天中天，　　說是無常法，
translation: The Tathāgata is a god among gods Who teaches the Dharma of impermanence.

source_sentence: 如坏器不堅，　　終趣於破壞。
translation: It's like a broken vessel that isn't strong and ultimately destined to break down.

source_sentence: 同菓熟自落，　　有情命如是，
translation: Like a fruit ripening and falling on its own, so is the life of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 苾芻今當知，　　生滅宜應怖。」
translation: Now, monks, you should know that it's appropriate to fear birth and cessation.

source_sentence: 復說偈言：爾時，世尊說是經已。
translation: At that time, the World-honoured One had discoursed on this sutra.

source_sentence: 諸苾芻眾一心信受，歡喜奉行。
translation: The monks wholeheartedly believed it and joyfully carried it out.
